name: Add debug print BEFORE builtin dispatch in len call
notes: The hang occurs after DEBUG: about to call len on main-tests but list_count is working. Add debug print in valk_builtin_len at line 2441 right at entry (before LVAL_ASSERT_COUNT_EQ) to verify whether the builtin is even being entered. Build and run timeout 10 build/valk test/test_debug_handler.valk to see if debug message appears.
accept: Debug print added, build passes, run shows whether builtin entry is reached before hang
reject: Debug print was NOT added to valk_builtin_len. The function has no debug print - it starts with UNUSED(e); then LVAL_ASSERT_COUNT_EQ. The test now crashes (dumps core) rather than hangs, with no debug output.

name: Document root cause finding
notes: After t-quk8 identifies the exact hang location, document: 1) Which function hangs, 2) What condition causes the infinite loop/hang, 3) Proposed fix approach. Update task t-7trq notes if the root cause is different from list_count.
accept: Root cause documented with specific line number and condition
reject: Task notes unchanged from placeholder text. No function name, line number, condition, or fix approach documented.

name: Fix len hang root cause
notes: After identifying the root cause via debugging tasks, implement the fix. Remove any debug prints added during investigation.
accept: make build passes and (len main-tests) no longer hangs

name: Clean up test_debug_handler.valk debug prints
notes: Previous iteration added debug prints. Remove these debug prints added during investigation. The file should be clean.
accept: No DEBUG: prints in test_debug_handler.valk except any that were original

name: Fix test_debug_handler.valk hang
notes: After diagnosing the hang cause, fix it. Remove debug prints added during debugging. The test should run to completion.
accept: timeout 30 build/valk test/test_debug_handler.valk completes with exit 0

name: Verify debug_handler tests pass reliably
notes: Run test_debug_handler.valk 5 times to ensure all 36 tests pass consistently. No TIMEOUT or failures.
accept: 5 consecutive runs all show 36 passed, 0 failed

name: Check for recursive evaluation in test code
notes: The debug shows len being called at increasing call_depth (1->2->3). Search the test file for any user-defined functions that call len. Check if run-main-tests-then-broadcaster or start-one-main-test or similar might be calling len recursively. Also check if the printf debug print on line 973 is ever reached by running the test with a shorter timeout.
accept: Identified whether hang is in Valk test code or C runtime

name: Add backtrace debug to len to show caller chain
notes: Modify valk_builtin_len to print a C backtrace (using backtrace() and backtrace_symbols() from execinfo.h) on first 3 calls to show which C functions lead to each len call. This will reveal whether the repeated calls come from valk_lval_call, valk_lval_eval, or user-defined function dispatch.
accept: Backtrace output shows the C call chain leading to each len call

name: Identify exact infinite loop location from backtrace
notes: Based on the backtrace output from t-rydh, identify which function is repeatedly calling into len. Common suspects: valk_lval_eval recursing, valk_lval_call with trampoline, or something in arg evaluation. Document the specific function and suspected infinite loop condition.
accept: Specific C function identified as the source of repeated len calls
